message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about Neural Machine Translation (NMT), which is a subfield of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and falls under the Computer Science category. The paper proposes a new approach to address the discrepancy between training and inference in NMT, which is a common problem in machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and related topics. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques such as sampling and optimization, which are covered in sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Additionally, the paper deals with the issue of error accumulation, which is related to the optimization process in neural networks. Therefore, sub-categories such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) may also be relevant. 

Finally, the paper uses experimental results to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach, which involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for image captioning. Therefore, sub-categories such as cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) may also be relevant.
